group_1.textCenter: Oh, you guys came early today!

group_1.textRight: ...What's up, Kira?@What's with the smile?

group_1.textLeft: From what I can tell, it looks like...
...she won't be using any words from now until@Valentine's Day.

group_1.textRight: ...Huh?!@Did I offend you somehow?

group_1.textLeft: No, it's just one of her whims.
We'd been talking about our Valentine's gifts,@and how if you know...
...someone well enough, you can tell what they want@without them having to say a word.
That's why she isn't saying anything.

group_1.narration: Komachi isn't quite right.@It's not that I won't say anything,@it's that I CAN'T say anything.
My own magic has forced me to remain silent.
The specific magic that resides in me,@according to Nemu Hiiragi...

group_1.textCenter: Perhaps it's been happening unconsciously?@You see, your magic...
I suppose you could call it "kotodama". A force that@controls people via the words you communicate.

group_1.narration: It means that my words@have some sort of compulsory effect on them.
The problem is that@I can't control when that magic activates.
This morning, I foolishly said I wouldn't use@a single word from now until Valentine's Day.
Therefore, I can't say anything anymore.

group_1.textCenter: (I had been just about to add that I was joking,)
(which would have retracted the statement, but...)

group_1.textLeft: (...Given her perceptiveness, I'm surprised that@Komachi hasn't noticed...)
(...that my silence isn't voluntary...)
(Well, it's just a small misunderstanding.@It'll be fine.)
(Even if she knew what was going on, I still wouldn't@be able to speak.)

group_1.textRight: Does this mean you're not communicating through@writing or telepathy, either?
What do you think, Kira?

group_1.textLeft: (...I can't reply in any way at all.)
(It seems like there are some pretty strong@restrictions in place...)

group_1.textRight: Looks like she's going all-in...
You mean she's not communicating with words,@period? Hmm...
...But why would she do something so weird all of@a sudden?

group_1.textLeft: Kira's always been like that.@Sometimes, she just does...
...whatever she feels like -@no deeper meaning than that.

group_1.textRight: Is that so?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, I see, of course you wouldn't know.
She's been pretty quiet ever since she got into@high school.
Out of nowhere, she got really into waka poetry@and started using quill pens.
You've always been a bit of an odd duck,@haven't you?

group_1.textRight: No wonder Komachi's been getting a kick out of you@all this time!

group_1.textCenter: (They're teasing me, and yet I can't refute them@in any way.)
(Somehow, though...I feel like I've seen this situation@before...)
(In "The Boy Who Became a Coin," the main@character transforms into a 10-yen coin.)
(There's a scene where he hears rumors about@himself, but he can't say any response as a coin.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I'm sure there's a method to her madness.

group_1.textRight: So at first, I was gonna ask what you guys wanted@for Valentine's Day.
But you're thinking we can figure it out without@having to say?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, this time.

group_1.textRight: So our Valentine's gift exchange...
...is becoming a "Guess What Kira Wants" party@instead!

group_1.textLeft: *Chuckle*

group_1.textRight: But you guys have been friends since you were kids.@You must know exactly what the other one wants.
Meanwhile, I'm kinda stumped...

group_1.textLeft: Kira, clearly, would like a book.

group_1.textRight: [chara:303901:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Is it really okay to just blurt it out like that?!

group_1.textLeft: Of course.@She said it herself, after all.

group_1.textCenter: If I were to receive any gift, I'd prefer a book.

group_1.textRight: You're right, she did say that...

group_1.textLeft: Hey, look at her face.

group_1.textRight: Bingo!

group_1.textLeft: But that begs the question: What kind of book@would she like?

group_1.textRight: Do you have an idea, Komachi?

group_1.textLeft: I'm pretty sure I know what it is.
I think...it must be that book she's been trying to@track down.

group_1.textCenter: (Just as I would expect from her.)
(I'll be looking forward to the second volume of@"The Boy Who Became a Coin.")

group_1.textRight: That's exactly what I'm talking about!
I just have no clue what I'm gonna do...

group_1.textLeft: We still have plenty of time. Why don't you ask@Kira yourself?
And if you hit a wall, you can ask me!
...Oh, it's that time already?@I have to get going.

group_1.textRight: Huh? Leaving so soon?

group_1.textLeft: I'm heading to the museum again today.
("The Teawares of Kamihama" exhibition...)
(It's a special show that she's been frequenting@a lot lately.)

group_1.textRight: You seem really enthusiastic about it!@See you tomorrow, then!
